message.content:
cs.CR, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.IT 

This paper deals with privacy issues in machine learning, specifically in the context of correlated data. The paper discusses a recent generalization of differential privacy called Pufferfish and proposes a new mechanism called the Wasserstein Mechanism to address privacy concerns in correlated data. This work involves both theoretical and practical aspects of machine learning and privacy, which suggests that it could be categorized under several sub-categories. However, given the focus on privacy and security, cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is the most likely category. The paper also deals with machine learning and data analysis, which suggests that it could also be categorized under cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Finally, the paper proposes new mechanisms for privacy-preserving analysis, which suggests that it could also be categorized under cs.IT (Information Theory).
